education.institution: BITS Pilani, K.K. Birla Goa Campus
education.studyType: Master of Science in Biological Sciences

work.name: Deep Forest Sciences
work.summary: Working on the development of an automated Image Segmentation pipeline for segmentation, counting and classification of cells in microscopic images using Machine Learning. The project involves the use of Deep Learning models like U-Net, Mask R-CNN, etc.

work.name: DeepChem
work.summary: I work on the development of DeepChem, an open-source Python library for deep learning in drug discovery, materials science, quantum chemistry, and biology. I have contributed to the development of the library and have also written a few tutorials on the same. I'm currently a Google Summer of Code (GSoC) mentor working on a project for Antibody Sequence Generation Using Protein Language Models.
highlights: Google Summer of Code(GSoC), Open Source, Tutorials

work.name: APPCAIR - BITS Pilani, K.K. Birla Goa Campus
work.summary: Studying the use of Large Language Models for generation of novel small molecules as potential drug candidates and their retrosynthesis. The project involves the use of GPT-4, Claude, etc. for the generation of novel molecules and their synthesis using a logical feedback loop with a chemist in the middle.
highlights: Large Language Models, Drug Discovery, Retrosynthesis, Molecular Generation

work.name: CSIR - Central Electronics Engineering Research Institute (CEERI)
work.summary: Implemented deep learning models to classify finger movements based on EEG signals. The project involved the use of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks for the classification of EEG signals. The use of Attention Mechanisms was also studied.
highlights: Time Series Data, EEG Signals, CNNs, LSTMs, Attention Mechanism

projects.name: Mixture of Experts layer from scratch
projects.summary: Implemented a Mixture of Experts layer from scratch using PyTorch. The project involved the implementation and benchmarking a BiLSTM model with and without the MoE layer on the CoNLL-2003 dataset for Named Entity Recognition (NER).

projects.name: Graph Attention And Graph Convolution Networks from scratch for Protein-Protein Interaction Prediction
projects.summary: Implemented Graph Attention Networks (GATs) and Graph Convolution Networks (GCNs) from scratch using PyTorch. The project involved the use of these models for Protein-Protein Interaction (PPI) prediction on the PPI dataset from PyG.

projects.name: Decoding finger movements from ECoG signals
projects.summary: Implemented a deep learning model to decode finger movements from Electrocorticography (ECoG) signals. The project involved the use of Attention based Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks for the decoding of multi-channel ECoG signals. State-of-the-art performance was achieved on the BCIC IV 4 dataset, surpassing the previous best by about 30%.

projects.name: Time Masked Autoencoder for Fluid Dynamics Prediction
projects.summary: Implemented a Time Masked Autoencoder for the prediction of fluid dynamics in a 2D grid. The model was trained on simulations of the Shallow Water equation and achieved high accuracy in predicting the fluid dynamics up to 10 frames in the future. The model utilized random masking with up to 80% coverage.

projects.name: Rock Detection and Classification System for a Mars Rover
projects.summary: Designed and implemented a Rock Detection and Classification System for a student built Mars Rover. The project involved the use of Computer Vision techniques like Object Detection and Transfer Learning for the detection and classification of rocks in images captured by the Rover. The system was able to detect and classify rocks with an accuracy of over 80%.

awards.title: INSPIRE Scholarship
awards.awarder: Department of Science and Technology, Government of India
awards.summary: Among top 1 percentile of science students in class 12 board examinations and performed consistently well in school.
